results.title: Goggles! (K)
results.creator_credit: Isa Wickenhagen, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Peter finds a pair of motorcycle goggles without lenses. He and Archie set off with their treasure but run into some big boys who demand the goggles. Suspense mounts as Peter and Archie, with the help of Peter’s loyal dachshund, Willie, attempt to outwit the bullies. Based on the book by Ezra Jack Keats.

results.title: God said, let Newton be
results.brief_description: A detailed discourse on Isaac Newton’s scientific discoveries contained in his Mathematic Principles of Natural Philosophy. Sets out to demonstrate that, over a period of 20 years, Newton solved the problem of planetary motion, and proved that he had done so, and that he believed he had demonstrated anew the true harmony of the heavens.

results.title: God's girls: stories from an australian convent
results.creator_credit: Cherie Nowlan, Glenys Rowe and Central Park Films
results.brief_description: A group of nuns, past and present, talk about life in a Sisters of Mercy convent in Singleton, N.S.W. from the 1940’s to the present day. This is a courageous and clever film that investigates the subtle complexities of change within a society that has been surrounded by mystery for hundreds of years. The film delves deeply into the beliefs of those women who have chosen to live a very different life to that of most women, but it also gives voice, with integrity, wit and sensitivity to those who have chosen to leave the cloister. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.

results.title: Go vegetarian
results.creator_credit: Mal Hamilton, Russell Gibbs, Adventist Media Centre and Streamline Digital
results.brief_description: The program examines vegetarianism as a healthy and exciting way of eating. It reviews the history of vegetarianism and the reasons why people have selected this option as a lifestyle choice. “Go vegetarian” examines the benefits of a vegetarian diet in terms of health, the environment and the economy as well as exploring the myths.

results.title: Go dream a kite
results.brief_description: Set in Toronto, Canada, this film tells the tale of two young children who have worked hard selling lemonade and cutting grass in order to buy a special kite. When they finally earn enough money the kite has already been sold.

results.title: Glued to the telly
results.creator_credit: Jo Lane, Stuart Menzies and Vixen Films
results.brief_description: Looks at the history of Australian television and how it has impacted on the lives and culture of Australians. The program provides statistics on television viewing and uses archival footage, interviews and drama segments to evaluate the impact of “telly”.

results.title: Glorious colour
results.creator_credit: Anne James and Anne James Productions
results.brief_description: Glorious Colour is a five, half hour program series on Kaffe Fassett, Artist/Designer working in the threefold areas of painting, knitting and needlepoint. Program 1- Introduction: at home. Program 2- Painting and knitting-studies Program 3- Developing colour sense Program 4- The knitters’ workshop Program 5- Textile Designing-Conclusions
